data.meanings: To think, consider, suppose, imagine, be of opinion.
data.sentence: The word أَيَحْسَبُونَ comes from the root ح س ب and is associated with the meanings: To think, consider, suppose, imagine, be of opinion.

data.meanings: to draw a thing (namely a rope), pull a thing, stretch a thing, strain a thing, extend by drawing or pulling, stretch forth, to prolong, expand/elongate/lengthen a thing, spread or spread out, delay or defer a thing, continue a thing, to help or aid someone, to advance, to increase, to supply ink (put ink into a thing), apply ink to a thing, manure land (with dung).
data.sentence: The word نُمِدُّهُمْ comes from the root م د د and is associated with the meanings: to draw a thing (namely a rope), pull a thing, stretch a thing, strain a thing, extend by drawing or pulling, stretch forth, to prolong, expand/elongate/lengthen a thing, spread or spread out, delay or defer a thing, continue a thing, to help or aid someone, to advance, to increase, to supply ink (put ink into a thing), apply ink to a thing, manure land (with dung).

data.meanings: To be abundant in weath, possess an abundance of property.
data.sentence: The word مَالٍ comes from the root م و ل and is associated with the meanings: To be abundant in weath, possess an abundance of property.
